body: Looks good to me. But it is out of my area of expertise. Will commit this if someone from within this area of expertise gives it the OK.
Do you plan to close this?
I am thinking to leave it open in case whoever is investigating the failure in TESTRTS, he can leverage that PR, since we know the bug shows up with it 100%?
Looks good, although the formatting seems weird in places.  Looks like there are a lot of white space errors (tabs).  Logic is good.

Most the formatting changes you see are actual differences in spacing.  It has to do with adding an if statement that surrounds an existing block of code, so all the code in those blocks were indented by 4 spaces.

In many cases, TrafConnection need use the stmtHandle to identify a statement, so we need it is unique. 
TrafStatement itself can't know the stmtHandle of other statements, so we need detect the duplicate in TrafConnection and then set it to TrafStatement. 
I use hashCode() since it make the changes simple, and in Java, hashCode() is a native method , we don't need to worry about the performance.

Yes, Dave, there will be more changes, and I will cancel this pull request and create a new one later. since there will be some big changes and will take some time, just keep this open for comments reference. Thanks all for the comments, it helps a lot.
Can one of the admins verify this patch?
Can one of the admins verify this patch?
Is there any overlap between the document changes in this change and the work Gunnar is doing to put contributor procedures into a document?
@DaveBirdsall, yes Gunnar will need to pick up these changes to the two markdown files I changed when he migrates them to asciidoc.

How do you build the documents in Eclipse on a PC if having to source env.sh? To date, it's been possible to work on documentation and website purely on Windows without having to set up a Trafodion Build Environment. Hopefully, this is just a matter of instructions.
@gtapper - It must be possible to set an environment variable in eclipse.  You don't necessarily have to source env.sh, but you at least have to set TRAFODION_VER in the environment.

In a Run configuration in eclipse, you can use the Environment tab to set any environment variables. You can also use different Maven profiles for eclipse and command line builds and choose to set the TRAFODION_VER differently for eclipse build.
Looks great. Thanks for doing this. I think it is ready for commit.
I will commit this at the end of the day today if there are no further comments.
It seems JIRA ID is incorrect. i'm not sure whether it can be changed.

Hi Kevin, my apologies for that. I was able to change the title of the pull
request, but the comments in the wrong JIRA are probably hard to remove.
Thanks for pointing out this mistake, I added a comment to the correct
JIRA, 1781.

Hans

hi, all, again,

I made some new changes, and it seems to be better now.
1. add more comments
2. make the translate implicit from GBK to UTF8 in HIVE_SCAN
3. add a test case, modify the hive/TEST005 to test this new change

Now, TRANSLATE( col using GBKTOUTF8) cannot be used directly, only when select from hive table, and HIVE_FILE_CHARSET is set to 'GBK'. So no other side effort is possible.

Please help to review again and comment.

thanks,
Ming
Previous Test Aborted. New Check Test Started: https://jenkins.esgyn.com/job/Check-PR-master/379/

Good to see that you were able to do the automatic conversion. The implementation looks good, but it is restricted to a narrow case of converting Hive tables from GBK to UTF-8. It might be good to add checks for that specific case (see comments above).
I found a few possible off-by-one kinds of bugs, but other than that (and the comments others raised) it looks good to me.
Looks good to me. Would like to hear what other reviewers say also.
Looks good to me. The logging should be especially helpful.

I'm sitting somewhat on the fence. Part of me thinks that this may be a step in the right direction and that it shouldn't harm, part of me is still questioning how this will work in the long term. Could the author (and others, of course) comment on these questions?
- Do we have a plan to get rid of all of the Trafodion-related HBase configuration entries? If not, does it make sense to do work to eliminate this one?
- I assume that there is no upgrade required. Existing tables will have the coprocessors configured globally, new ones (after this change) will have per-table coprocessors?
- How do we switch coprocessors, e.g. going from MVCC to another method to handle concurrency? Today, this is done by editing the config file?
- Even this new method has dependencies. How are we going to manage the jar files required - is that going to be different from what we do today? Today this is done by the installer.
- Can this change avoid a restart of HBase? If we add a table-specific coprocessor that requires a jar file, won't that jar file have to be in the classpath of the region server? And, adding it to the classpath would require a restart?

Sorry, some of my questions come from a lack of understanding how this all works.

I am attempting to commit this but am running into git difficulties that I don't understand. (In my workspace, it showed conflicts in some of the files, which I resolved. But it also shows file additions and deletions for files that don't seem to be connected to this pull request.) I don't want to commit it until I understand what is going on. And I'll need some help for that. I will try to resolve this tomorrow. 

Another possibility is to close this pull request, and submit a fresh one with just the intended changes. 

I'm very sorry this is taking so long.
Code looks good to me. I have a couple of questions, no need to answer them before you commit if you don't see an issue with them.

hi, Hans,
I have some feedback:
•Do we have a plan to get rid of all of the Trafodion-related HBase configuration entries? If not, does it make sense to do work to eliminate this one?
  Yes, this is the first effort to get rid of all Trafodion-related HBase configuration entries. Another big one is to avoid overloading HRegion, HBase 1.2 already changes it for Trafodion. So all left are some configuration items, some I am rather sure we can do in Trafodion code instead of hbase-site.xml. Still 2 or 3 need investigation. But this single change will benefit still in some special cases, like CDH regionsServer group.

•I assume that there is no upgrade required. Existing tables will have the coprocessors configured globally, new ones (after this change) will have per-table coprocessors?
  No upgrade required. After this change, in fact, nothing changes . Trafodion still have the hbase-site.xml modified by installer, and if hbase-site.xml exist, it will take higher priority and all these new logic will not take effect. Just when hbase-site.xml doesn't have the coprocessor configured. These new code will take effect. So when we are confident enough , we can remove hbase-site.xml coprocessor configs.

•How do we switch coprocessors, e.g. going from MVCC to another method to handle concurrency? Today, this is done by editing the config file?
  Today, one must edit the ms.env and restart Trafodion to switch.

•Even this new method has dependencies. How are we going to manage the jar files required - is that going to be different from what we do today? Today this is done by the installer.
  No different about jar file handling.

•Can this change avoid a restart of HBase? If we add a table-specific coprocessor that requires a jar file, won't that jar file have to be in the classpath of the region server? And, adding it to the classpath would require a restart?
  If Trafodion doesn't have other hbase-site.xml dependencies, like overload the HRegion, this will avoid a restart of HBase. If one coprocessor needs a jar , admin MUST put it into the CLASSPATH that HBase RegionServer started with, even without this change, it is same. It will not need a restart. I will write a small demo to test it and share with you later. That can help better to understand this topic.

thanks,
Ming

Hi Ming, thanks for answering the questions. I think your answers show that this change doesn't really get us closer to eliminating the dependency between HBase and Trafodion. BTW, I totally agree that overloading the region class would be very good to avoid.

Since the change also doesn't make the dependency worse and since you have a plan to go forward I am ok with that.
With Steve Varnau's help, I now know why my efforts were failing. I was trying to merge this into the wrong branch! Good thing I didn't complete it.
I'm committing this to the apache/release1.3 branch now.
Thanks for making the updates. You've worked very hard on getting this feature in, which will be very valuable. The changes look good to me now.

Looks good to me.
For the binary downloads, are any caveats required about "convenience" binaries?

By the way, the site repo is not a "SVN repository" it is a git repository.

To publish the 2.0.0 docs (in-development, un-released), an update is needed to documentation.md, right?  Do you want to update that page?

Hi,

From what I understand, we're good with those binaries since they are
stored on the same servers as the daily builds. If this is wrong, then
someone PLEASE speak up.

Yes, you expose the new documentation by editing documentation.md. Why
don't you give it a shot; it's an easy copy/paste/edit exercise.

Oops on the SVN. :)

Gunnar

_If you think you can you can, if you think you can't you're right._

Hi again,

I should have been clearer. The _latest_ documentation points to the 2.0.0
documents as soon as you publish them. The documentation.md file needs to
updated to add the 2.0.0 entries.

I went back and forth on this approach until I concluded that _latest_
should mean "the latest version of the document" assuming that such
documentation would handle backward compatibility issues, if needed. Plus,
anyone downloading a specific version of Trafodion (for example, 1.3.0) can
easily find the release-specific version on
http://trafodion.incubator.apache.org/documentation.html.

Hopefully, I didn't confuse more than help here. :)

Gunnar
